results.title: Adrenergic Blockade Bi-directionally and Asymmetrically Alters Functional Brain-Heart Communication and Prolongs Electrical Activities of the Brain and Heart during Asphyxic Cardiac Arrest
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_10116 @@@Rats@@@ received either saline, @CHEMICAL_Phentolamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010646 @@@phentolamine@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, or @CHEMICAL_Phentolamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010646 @@@phentolamine@@@ plus @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, 30 min before the onset of @<m>DISEASE_Asphyxia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001237 @@@asphyxia@@@.

citations.NLM: Tian F, Liu T, Xu G, Li D, Ghazi T, Shick T, Sajjad A, Wang MM, Farrehi P, Borjigin J. Adrenergic Blockade Bi-directionally and Asymmetrically Alters Functional Brain-Heart Communication and Prolongs Electrical Activities of the Brain and Heart during Asphyxic Cardiac Arrest Front Physiol. 2018;9():99.
